image.altText: a black and blotchy graphic of Kamala Harris in front of an illuminati pyramid

props.synopsis: Only minutes after US Vice-President Kamala Harris announced she would run for president, deeply offensive false narratives about her began to resurface.

title.children: The 'most derided woman' in US politics is running for president. It's triggered a fresh wave of racist tropes

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Joe Biden, who walked the halls of power for half a century, built a career on relationships. But in the end, it was his decision alone to do something no president had done before.

title.children: Biden held firm against a Democratic rebellion. Then his old political allies stepped in

image.altText: graphic of folder with sale icon

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity experts have found advertisements claiming to re-sell highly sensitive data of millions of Australians, stolen from eScripts provider MediSecure, on the dark web, and now it's half price.

title.children: Cybercriminals are selling the sensitive data of almost 13 million Australians — for just $25,000

image.altText: BMW plug-in hybrid charger

props.synopsis: A tax benefit has allowed Australians to save tens of thousands of dollars when buying plug-in hybrid cars but the motor industry warns that is set to end next year and it could slow sales and undermine emissions reduction efforts.

title.children: Plug-in hybrid car sales have surged but an expiring tax discount could soon end the party

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: Australia has done exceptionally well riding the boom in the Chinese economy. But the political and economic uncertainty surrounding the world's two biggest economies — the US and China — point to tougher times ahead.

title.children: While all eyes are on Washington, China is quietly heading into economic oblivion

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiling and a man with blond hair and pursed lips

props.synopsis: Never before has a major US political party switched horses midstream this close to a presidential election. There are so many unknowns.

title.children: If it's a Harris and Trump showdown, there's a huge question where no one knows the answer

image.altText: President Biden stands in front of a microphone wearing a black suit and blue tie with an American flag pinned to his lapel

props.synopsis: Concerns about the 46th US president's age have been around since his 2020 campaign but after a shambolic debate performance, worries about his capacity for another term became too loud to ignore.

title.children: Biden's legacy will extend beyond his one term in office. But the timing of his exit could have a profound impact on the election

image.altText: A composite image of Mary Fowler, Lauren Jackson and Charlotte Caslick.

props.synopsis: Ten teams across six sports will represent Australia at the Paris Olympic Games, and many of them have genuine hopes of taking a medal home with them.

title.children: From the Matildas to the Gungaroos — everything you need to know about the Aussie teams bidding for gold in Paris

image.altText: Kamala gestures at a podium.

props.synopsis: With US President Joe Biden announcing he will not stand for re-election in November, Kamala Harris is seen as a potential successor. But who is she?

title.children: Kamala Harris is used to breaking barriers. But could she become the first woman to be the US president?

image.altText: a purple light illuminates a thick web of computer cables in a dark room

props.synopsis: Australian businesses are assessing the damage bill from last week's CrowdStrike outage and expect the impact of the glitch to last for months.

title.children: CrowdStrike outage tipped to leave Australian businesses with damage bill surpassing $1 billion

image.altText: Thumbnail - Tiktok video

props.synopsis: Steven Miles has hit out at his opponent after the Queensland opposition used artificial intelligence to create a fake video to mock the premier.

title.children: 'Appalling': Queensland premier slams AI-generated political attack ad posted by opposition

image.altText: A man and three children stand in front of the ruins of a building

props.synopsis: The Israeli military attacks the city of Khan Younis, which it designated a humanitarian zone, moments after ordering an evacuation of the area to take out Hamas targets.

title.children: Dozens of Palestinians killed in humanitarian zone near Khan Younis, immediately after Israel orders evacuation

image.altText: Before and after imagery shows widespread damage to trees and buildings.

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery has revealed the extent of damage to the Gaza War Cemetery at Deir El Belah, which is mainly dedicated to fallen Allied personnel, including more than 250 Australians.

title.children: Australian war graves in historic Gaza cemetery feared damaged or destroyed following Israel's invasion

image.altText: A composite of a man smiling on the left and a baby looking at camera on the right

props.synopsis: A childhood friend of Anand Runwal, who died while trying to save his twin daughters from an oncoming train at Carlton rail station, described him as a loving family man who always stayed in touch with his friends.

title.children: 'Family man': Father who tragically died trying to save twin daughters dreamed of parents moving to Australia

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair wearing a blue suit looks past the camera

props.synopsis: An attempted assassination, an "unacceptable" Secret Service response and a subpoena demanding she appear before a public hearing — here's what's ahead for Kimberly Cheatle.

title.children: Secret Service director Kim Cheatle once said she 'thrives on chaos'. An assassination attempt puts that claim to the test

image.altText: A police officer stands behind police tape on a quiet European street as people talk nearby.

props.synopsis: An armed man entered an aged care facility in central Croatia on Monday and opened fire, killing five people and wounding several others, authorities and media reports said.

title.children: Gunman kills at least five in 'frightening' attack on aged care facility in Croatia

image.altText: Light blue background with a Sydney cityscape in the background with three houses in boxes on top

props.synopsis: We found out the stories behind some of Sydney's empty homes by tracking down owners using property data and other public records and knocking on doors.

title.children: We tracked down the owners of Sydney's 'ghost homes' to try and find out why they've been left vacant

image.altText: A man wearing a dark hoodie pictured from behind, in front of a business called "Harlots".

props.synopsis: William says he and other NDIS participants have the same wants and aspirations as anybody else — and a sex work ban would deny a whole section of the community from a "deeply ingrained human need" based just on their circumstances.

title.children: NDIS participants using sex workers fear ban will deny some people with disability a 'normal life'

image.altText: Joe Biden speaking into a microphone in front of an American flag

props.synopsis: After his announcement that he will not be contesting the upcoming presidential election, we've taken a look back at Mr Biden's career in pictures.

title.children: A look back at US President Joe Biden's political career in pictures

image.altText: Oscar Piastri sprayed with champange after winning the Hungarian Grand Prix

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has become the fifth Australian to win a Formula 1 grand prix, taking the chequered flag for McLaren in Hungary.

title.children: Oscar Piastri becomes fifth Australian to win F1 grand prix after nervous moment with teammate on last laps

image.altText: A dark grey skeleton of the stegosaurus is seen in profile from its head to halfway up its bony neck

props.synopsis: About 150 million years after its death, the stegosaurus nicknamed Apex has been sold to a private buyer.

title.children: Stegosaurus skeleton sells for record $67.5m at US auction

image.altText: Tortoise

props.synopsis: Conservationists have successfully released 560 giant tortoises to the Galápagos Islands as part of a scheme to boost the numbers of the animal, which once came close to extinction.

title.children: Hundreds of giant tortoises return to Galápagos Islands as part of conservation program

image.altText: A young male soldier wearing combat uniform standing with fellow soldiers

props.synopsis: Taiwan's military holds drills across the island that mimic real-life combat in a series of exercises designed to prevent Taipei being seized by Chinese forces.

title.children: Taiwan holds unscripted war games after Chinese 'punishment' drills

image.altText: A close up photo of Wendy Ruth Sym wearing black reading glasses.

props.synopsis: A Perth woman collapses in a court dock after being sentenced to nine years in prison for trying to murder her husband who had been diagnosed with dementia.

title.children: Nurse collapses in court after being jailed for attempted murder of husband with insulin

image.altText: A person taps a black credit or debit card on a payment terminal.

props.synopsis: Card surcharges are banned in some countries, but they are legal in Australia. Here are some ways you can avoid paying extra.

title.children: Why inserting or swiping your card could help you save on surcharges

image.altText: Police officers patrol in front of the Eiffel Tower.

props.synopsis: Staring down 10 million visitors and 10,000 athletes expected to pour in for the Paris Olympics, France's terror alert is at its highest level with the country facing "a challenging time" to host the Games.

title.children: 'We're living in difficult times': A look into the security threats facing the Paris Olympics

image.altText: A landscape image of mountains covered in snow.

props.synopsis: The adequacy of police search efforts for Canberra man Andrew Seton, who was an experienced skier missing in the NSW Snowy Mountains, is at the centre of the coronial inquest into his death.

title.children: Inquest hears search for missing skier began more than a day after his mother alerted emergency services

image.altText: Biden Trump Albanese

props.synopsis: Joe Biden steps down and Kamala Harris steps up as Donald Trump's overwhelming ascendancy leaves both sides of Australian politics talking about what a second age of Trump would mean.

title.children: Biden dropped out and threw his support behind Kamala. Here's why 2024 could still turn into 'chaos'

image.altText: Exterior photos of Parliament House in Hobart, Tasmania bathed in sunshine.

props.synopsis: Letters written with poisoned ink, missiles thrown at politicians' homes and a heated debate about the flooding of Lake Pedder. It was in this climate in 1972 that a shot was fired one night through the window of Tasmania's parliament house.

title.children: The mystery surrounding a 50-year-old bullet hole inside Tasmania's Parliament House

image.altText: Worker welding

props.synopsis: A study by Curtin University has found 90 per cent of welders are being exposed to carcinogenic welding fumes, some at high levels. A public health expert and union official say the issue needs to be taken as seriously as silica and asbestos exposure.

title.children: When Mark inhaled too many fumes as a welding apprentice, he was told to drink 'a cup of milk'

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair.

props.synopsis: Like her mother, Tarnika became addicted to drugs and went to prison. The number of First Nations women being incarcerated is on the rise.

title.children: Tarnika found her mum living in a cardboard box and addicted to drugs

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: A neighbour of missing mother Amber Haigh says Robert Samuel Geeves told her and Ms Haigh "about how he killed his ex-wife".

title.children: Amber Haigh's accused murderer confessed to killing previous partner, murder trial hears

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a suit stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: Local Government Minister Ron Hoenig wrote to the council to respond to findings from an interim report that identified alleged "potential maladministration and/or corruption".

title.children: Embattled Sydney council to mount legal challenge against NSW government

image.altText: Reece Walsh of the Maroons runs the ball during Game I of the State of Origin

props.synopsis: Reece Walsh says Joseph-Aukuso Sua'ali'i has shown himself as a "class human being" in seeking him out for an on-field apology after State of Origin III.

title.children: Walsh praises 'class human' Sua'ali'i after apology for brutal Origin knock out

image.altText: Glenda Mippy close

props.synopsis: The officer who was in charge on the night a teenager was found unresponsive in his cell at a controversial WA juvenile detention facility is excused from giving evidence at the inquest into the boy's death. WARNING: This story discusses incidents of self-harm and contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: 'It's not right': Cleveland Dodd's family frustrated key witness won't testify at coronial inquest
